1978 — Intel 8086

A 16-bit architecture, incompatible with the Intel 8080, but claimed to be source code compatible, with a lot of similarities in its design. Later extensions included the NEC V20 and NEC ÂµPD9002, the Intel 80286, Intel 80386 and the 64-bit AMD64.

Address space
20-bit
I/O space
16-bit
